awd_abstract_narration: This award funds a series of conferences designed to foster research and discussion of major issues in macroeconomics and monetary economics that are important for public policy. The conference series has three goals. First, to stimulate new research that develops new models and analyzes economic data. Second, to bring together researchers who approach the science questions in different ways. Third, to develop greater understanding among academic researchers of the multiple factors that influence the formation of economic policy. The conference brings together a diverse audience with the overall goal of encouraging academic researchers to focus on problems that are of importance for policy questions.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Social and Economic Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The Carnegie-NYU-Rochester Conference on Public Policy has been held eleven times since the granting of this award, including the 100th conference in the series (April 2023).  One scheduled meeting in April of 2020 was postponed until April 2021 because of Covid-19 restrictions.  Three meetings, November 2020, April 2021, November 2021, were held virtually via Zoom.  All conference papers and formal discussions were subsequently published as a special issue of the Journal of Monetary Economics (JME links provided). 

 

November 2017

Location:  Carnegie Mellon University, Tepper School of Business

Topic:  "The Consequences of Transformative Technical Progress for the Macroeconomy"

JME issue:  https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/journal-of-monetary-economics/vol/97/suppl/C

 

April 2018  

Location:  Rochester University, Simon School of Business

Topic:  "Honoring The Contributions of Charles Plosser to Economics"

JME issue:  https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/journal-of-monetary-economics/vol/105/suppl/C

 

November 2018

Location:  Carnegie Mellon University, Tepper School of Business

Topic:  "Tax Reform: Implications for Growth, Inequality, and Welfare"

JME issue:  https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/journal-of-monetary-economics/vol/105/suppl/C

 

April 2019

Location:  The Stern School of Business, New York University

Topic:  "On the Border of International Cooperation"

JME issue:  https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/journal-of-monetary-economics/vol/109/suppl/C 

 

November 2019  

Location:  Tepper School of Business, Carnegie Mellon University

Topic:  "Migration Policy: Implications for Growth, Inequality, and Welfare"

JME issue:  https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/journal-of-monetary-economics/vol/113/suppl/C

 

April 2020 (Delayed until April 2021 due to Covid-19 restrictions)

 

November 2020  

Location:  Tepper School of Business, Carnegie Mellon University (via Zoom)

Topic:  "Market Power and Macro Policy"

JME issue:  https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/journal-of-monetary-economics/vol/121/suppl/C

 

April 2021

Location:  Simon School of Business, Rochester University (via Zoom)

Topic:  "Central Banking in the 2020s and Beyond"

JME issue:  https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/journal-of-monetary-economics/vol/125/suppl/C

 

November 2021 

Location:  Tepper School of Business, Carnegie Mellon University (via Zoom)

Topic:  "Economic Access and Mobility: Enhancing Opportunity in the 21st Century"

JME issue:  https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/journal-of-monetary-economics/vol/129/suppl/C

 

November 2022 

Location:  Tepper School of Business, Carnegie Mellon University

Topic:  "Economic Resilience and Interconnectedness"

JME issue:  https://www-sciencedirect-com.proxy.library.nyu.edu/journal/journal-of-monetary-economics/vol/137/suppl/C

 

April 2022 

Location:  The Stern School of Business, New York University

Topic:  "The Joint Dynamics of Growth and Inequality in the Developed World"

JME issue:  https://www-sciencedirect-com.proxy.library.nyu.edu/journal/journal-of-monetary-economics/vol/133/suppl/C

 

April 2023 (100th conference in the series)

Location:  Simon School of Business, Rochester University

Topic:  "International Policy Coordination and Competition"

JME issue:  https://www-sciencedirect-com.proxy.library.nyu.edu/journal/journal-of-monetary-economics/vol/141/suppl/C

 

 


Last Modified: 07/27/2024
Modified by: Stanley E Zin
